frontmatter.title: 21 lessons before 21
frontmatter.description: From my playlists to my life.

node.excerpt: Here's a well-known mantra: love yourself before you love someone else. Simple words, right? But it's hard to love someone who sabotages all your real moments. The person who can't focus on losing the extra weight. The one that doesn't believe you're…

frontmatter.title: Revoked Access
frontmatter.description: One day I made the choice.

node.excerpt: Sometimes I can't find a way to write concisely and coherently, but when I run out of ideas, I can always trust my thought flow to write whatever comes to mind and fight writer's block. Sometimes it ends up being the same thing over and over, and…

frontmatter.title: Empty Corridors
frontmatter.description: Frustration when I realized I was counting.

node.excerpt: I never imagined the most embarrassing moment of my year would be reading a poem out loud because up to that moment, I never thought of releasing them to the world just yet. But as I was shaking nervously when I decided I'd do it, I realized that I…

frontmatter.title: If It Happens At All
frontmatter.description: Here's to still hoping a bit.

node.excerpt: I went through the years "milestoning" each age as if something magical would happen and change everything. Ever since I started writing, I wanted to create something to sum up my whole year in some way. At 18, I wrote that I wouldn't act my age, but…

frontmatter.title: Checkboxes
frontmatter.description: Still daydreaming a lot, still swearing in thoughts.

node.excerpt: I've read a lot about how repetition is a magic element in songwriting, but it's hard to tell if you're overdoing it. Trying to diversify what I'm writing, I end up getting stuck with a lot of wordy pieces that wouldn't fit a melody if I begged them…

"Where do you see yourself in ten years?" is the kind of question that gives me serious goosebumps. I hate to be reminded that everything will keep changing, and they will in the months to come. However, the past is also tough to face if you're not…

frontmatter.title: We Don't Talk About Future
frontmatter.description: The only safe bet is someday I'm gonna be gone.

node.excerpt: Convincing yourself that some things wouldn't work out is hard. I wrote this one in an attempt to believe it, hiding the predictable title choice behind an acronym. YDWML! Feeling too much and too fast  It’s not healthy for me  Not healthy for you if…

frontmatter.title: YDWML!
frontmatter.description: Not healthy for me, not healthy for you if you knew.

node.excerpt: I've tried many approaches when it comes to writing, but one method that I love is coming up with a title first. And titles come out of nowhere. For instance, I held onto the idea of a two-part song with similar messages, but different approaches…

frontmatter.title: In Case You Ever Listen
frontmatter.description: My mind goes as far as that and it doesn't get back as soon as you do.

node.excerpt: Today is Children's Day in Brazil and once again I'm not home for the occasion. I think it means a lot transition-wise for me, considering the whole symbolism of living alone and away from my family. Anyway, today is not supposed to be a sad moment…

frontmatter.title: Home, Home

frontmatter.description: Believe me if you can, I know I'm biased.
